channel.title: Got an error while compiling. How to fix it?
channel.description: [b]I just added a new command and now got this error when i try to compile.. how to fix it please? [/b] [img]http://img803.imageshack.us/img803/8216/newerror.jpg[/img] [b] Thanks,[/b]

item.title: Got an error while compiling. How to fix it?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

dzeko:

i just added what you told me zyle and compiled, but same thing… every command that i type it gives me a message… =s

Yes. It is going to show it for every command at the moment. It is a diagnostic measure to see where exactly things are going wrong.

Check your messages.

Read full topic

item.source: Got an error while compiling. How to fix it?

item.title: Got an error while compiling. How to fix it?
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

^Yeah, let me give you a little lesson in java, when you see something like:

public class exampleProgram {

That is showing that your opening the file, exampleProgram, and when you end it with a bracket at the end of a file, it shows that the file stops. Also when you see this,

pulic static void main(String[] args) {

It shows that you are starting the main method, which if you run a file, that’s what JVM will look for, and all the public voids and such, will get called from this main method. You understand?
Edit: TV bro?

Read full topic

item.title: Got an error while compiling. How to fix it?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“dzeko, post:76, topic:418021”]me i guess…

but i’ve find the 2 which arent closed…

[quote]public class Commands implements PacketType {

@Override
public void processPacket(Client c, int packetType, int packetSize) [b]{[/b]
String playerCommand = c.getInStream().readString();
final String[] Args = playerCommand.toLowerCase().split(" ");
c.sendMessage(playerCommand);
c.sendMessage(Arrays.toString(Args));

if (Args.length == 0) {
return;
}[/quote]

but dont know where to close these…[/quote]

Those are closed at the bottom.

Read full topic
item.source: Got an error while compiling. How to fix it?

item.title: Got an error while compiling. How to fix it?
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“dzeko, post:74, topic:418021”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=520567.msg3781722#msg3781722 date=1318544007]

the command works i think, because it gives me givedonors [givedonnors, 50, test]

but its says this message on every command that i type… even if i type ::blablabla it gives me a message…

Now that is fucking weird. Not thew fact that it says it, but the fact that there’s two n’s in “givedonnors” unless that was a mistake by you.
[/quote]

sorry it was a mistake by me…

but heres my command.java now.

http://pastebin.com/K9hMRK4e

i guess there is bracket which isn’t closed between lines 17 and 28[/quote]
NO NO NO NO NO!!! That will close off the class, which means no commands and all, but do what zyle said, since their is no command if the answer is false, it may do that, but you still may have a bracket issue

Read full topic

public class Commands implements PacketType [b]{[/b]

public void processPacket(Client c, int packetType, int packetSize) [b]{[/b]
String playerCommand = c.getInStream().readString();
final String[] Args = playerCommand.toLowerCase().split(" ");
c.sendMessage(playerCommand);
c.sendMessage(Arrays.toString(Args));

if (Args.length == 0) {
return;
}</blockquote>

but dont know where to close these…

item.title: Got an error while compiling. How to fix it?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“dzeko, post:64, topic:418021”]give me a non-sens error… dont even know why it gives me this error…

src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:33: cannot assign a value to fina l variable playerCommand playerCommand = playerCommand.substring(1); ^ Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

i’ve try to put PlayerCommand = playerCommand.substring(1); , but same error… =s[/quote]

You weren’t supposed to add the second block of code. I said after the code in the second block (which is the first thing in the method) add the third block of code.

Read full topic

item.source: Got an error while compiling. How to fix it?

item.title: Got an error while compiling. How to fix it?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“dzeko, post:62, topic:418021”]heres my command.java

http://pastebin.com/7YMP17QX[/quote]

Add this to the imports:

import java.util.Arrays;

and after

final String playerCommand = c.getInStream().readString();
final String[] args = playerCommand.toLowerCase().split(" ");

add

c.sendMessage(playerCommand);
c.sendMessage(Arrays.toString(args));

Then try doing the command, and post what gets put in the chatbox.

Read full topic
